resources.string: Breast Cancer Wisconsin Data Set: Explaination
Breast Cancer Wisconsin Data Set: Example

Learning Method: MLP (Multilayer Perceptron)

Learning Library: SKLearn

Pre-processing:\n\tThe data directly from the repository has missing values, to compensate for this the values were replaced with zero. I plain to create more methods of training to determine the most accurate, some of which will remove these rows of unknown data rather than replacing them.\n

Training:\n\tTraining is done by first shuffling the pre-processed data and seperating it into 50-25-25. 50 percent of our data is being used for training, 25 percent is being used for testing, and 25 percent is being used for validation to prevent overfitting. The hidden layer has been set to 15 for this run as it has gotten the lowest error from testing. The activation function used was the logistic function which is the sigmoid function.
